info.title: Patient Questionnaire Service REST API - OpenAPI 3.0
info.description:
REST API contract for the patient questionnaire service. Includes patient-facing and admin-facing endpoints.

Some useful links:
- [Questionnaire Service Repository](https://github.com/projectronin/prodeng-patient-questionnaire)

tags.name: Admin
tags.description: Endpoints used by the admin console

tags.name: Patient
tags.description: Endpoints used by the patient apps

tags.name: Clinician Dashboard
tags.description: Endpoints used by the provider on the clinician dashboard

tags.name: Common
tags.description: Endpoints used by both the clinician dashboard and the patient app

post.description: Create a questionnaire for a tenant

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: The ID of the tenant who will be using the questionnaire

get.description: Fetch questionnaires for a single tenant

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: The ID of the tenant who will be using the questionnaire

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Paging param to control the number of questionnaires to get back

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Zero-indexed page number

put.description: Update a questionnaire for a tenant

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: The ID of the tenant who will be using the questionnaire

parameters.name: questionnaireId
parameters.description: The ID of the questionnaire that is being updated. If omitted, a new questionnaire will be created

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: The ID of the tenant for the current tenant

parameters.name: patientId
parameters.description: The UDP ID of the current patient

parameters.name: includeAssignments
parameters.description: Whether to include the `isAssigned` value. Including this value requires a call to another service, so it should only be included when absolutely required (eg, when the user is a provider). Defaults to `false`

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Paging param to control the number of questionnaires to get back. Required when user is a provider

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Zero-indexed page number. Required when user is a provider

put.description: Idempotent operation to assign and unassign questionnaires for a patient

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: The ID of the tenant for the current tenant

parameters.name: patientId
parameters.description: The UDP ID of the current patient

get.description: Fetch a single questionnaire by ID for a patient

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: The ID of the tenant for the current tenant

parameters.name: patientId
parameters.description: The UDP ID of the current patient

parameters.name: questionnaireId
parameters.description: The ID of the questionnaire

post.description: Create a questionnaire response for a patient

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: The ID of the tenant for the current tenant

parameters.name: patientId
parameters.description: The UDP ID of the current patient

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: The ID of the tenant for the current tenant

parameters.name: patientId
parameters.description: The UDP ID of the current patient

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter responses by status

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Paging param to control the number of questionnaires to get back

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Zero-indexed page number

put.description: Update a questionnaire response for a patient

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: The ID of the tenant for the current tenant

parameters.name: patientId
parameters.description: The UDP ID of the current patient

parameters.name: questionnaireResponseId
parameters.description: The ID of the questionnaire response

patch.description: Complete a questionnaire response for a patient

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: The ID of the tenant for the current tenant

parameters.name: patientId
parameters.description: The UDP ID of the current patient

parameters.name: questionnaireResponseId
parameters.description: The ID of the questionnaire response

CompleteQuestionnaireResponse_RequestBod.description: Request Body For Completing a Questionnaire Response

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: The ID of the tenant for the current tenant

parameters.name: patientId
parameters.description: The UDP ID of the current patient

parameters.name: questionnaireId
parameters.description: The ID of the questionnaire

id.description: Non-globally unique - only unique within a group

AnswerValue.description: Possible values to be used based on the type of answer being provided

valueCoding.description: Used for single and multiple-choice questions, as we can use the `system` and `code` values to find the correct value set, and value within the value set

code.description: Computer-friendly representation of the answer option

display.description: Human-friendly representation of the answer option

Answer.description: Object containing a polymorphic answer, along with the type of answer

EnableWhen.description: Predicates that determine whether a questionnaire item should be processed

behavior.description: `ANY` means at least one of the predicates must be true - `ALL` means all predicates must be true

questionnaireId.description: ID of the questionnaire that is being responded to

version.description: Version of the questionnaire that is being responded to

alertLevel.description: Rollup of the alert level of all `item`s. Should only be populated in the HTTP response - not part of a request to upsert a questionnaire response

questionnaireItemId.description: `id` of the questionnaire item that is being processed/answered

text.description: Equal to the `text` value of the associated questionnaire. Should only be populated in the HTTP response - not part of a request to upsert a questionnaire response

QuestionnaireItemType.description: Represents if/how the answer should be answered. For `GROUP` questions, there should be no answer, but there must be child questionnaire items

page.description: Zero-indexed page. Value is set in the request query params

limit.description: Max limit of the number of records to get back in response. Value is set in the request query params

providerFacing.description: Name of the questionnaire that the provider sees

patientFacing.description: Name of the questionnaire that the patient sees

ehrOrderableId.description: Identifier of the orderable in the EHR

group.description: ID of the questionnaire group that the questionnaire belongs to

selectedTimestamp.description: Date and time that the file was selected

file.description: ID of the file that contains the questionnaire JSON

ManagementApi_TriageConfiguration.description: List of provider's and their associated triaging party. This will contain all the providers who can assign this questionnaire

QuestionnaireListItem.description: Minified representation of a questionnaire. Used when fetching a list of questionnaires

isAssigned.description: Whether the patient has been assigned to take the questionnaire. Only provided when the "includeAssignments" query param is set to "true"

FetchQuestionnaire_ResponseBody.description: Response body when fetching a single questionnaire by ID

QuestionnaireAssignment_RequestBody.description: Request body used for assigning and un-assigning questionnaires to patients

add.description: IDs of questionnaires that should be assigned

remove.description: IDs of questionnaires that should be un-assigned

FetchQuestionnaireResponses_ResponseBody.description: Response body containing a list of patient questionnaire responses

repeat.description: See FHIR `Timing -> repeat` object for inspiration https://www.hl7.org/fhir/datatypes.html#Timing

frequency.description: Number of times to take the questionnaire per period

period.description: The patient should take the questionnaire `frequency` times per period

boundsDuration.description: Defines how long a questionnaire will be assigned

value.description: Number of `code`s that make up the duration. Eg, `value: 6` and `code: "mo"` means a duration of 6 months

icon.description: Eg, The red triangle with exclamation mark in the images above; this is a string used to identify the icon the client should use

backgroundColor.description: Hex representation of the color behind the header icon and other surrounding text

text.description: The text to show in the header on successfully sending a message (Send to Care Team  in the first image)

color.description: Hex representation of the color of the header title - Should be a hex string (e.g. #FFFFFF for white)

text.description: The subtitle text that appears above the symptoms list (Your care team will be notified due to your respones for: in the first image)

color.description: Hex representation of the color of the symptoms subtitle

text.description: The text to show in the body when message delivery is successful (You should expect a response within 24 hours, during clinic hours. in the second image)

color.description: Hex representation of the color of the text in the body title

writeIn.description: Copy to show above the write-in text field

text.description: The text to show in the footer at the bottom of each image

icon.description: Eg, The red triangle with exclamation mark in the images above; this is a string used to identify the icon the client should use

backgroundColor.description: Hex representation of the color behind the header icon and other surrounding text

text.description: The text to show in the header on successfully sending a message (Send to Care Team  in the first image)

color.description: Hex representation of the color of the header title - Should be a hex string (e.g. #FFFFFF for white)

text.description: The subtitle text that appears above the symptoms list (Your care team will be notified due to your respones for: in the first image)

color.description: Hex representation of the color of the symptoms subtitle

text.description: The text to show in the body when message delivery is successful (You should expect a response within 24 hours, during clinic hours. in the second image)

color.description: Hex representation of the color of the text in the body title

failureAlert.description: UI element to show when an error has occurred

text.description: The text to show in the footer at the bottom of each image

error.description: Human readable form of the exception or httpStatus. This MUST be included

detail.description: A human readable message that describes the specific failure

ManagementApi_UpsertQuestionnaire_Reques.summary: Example request body for creating a questionnaire that is available to take any time for six months

QuestionnaireAssignment_RequestBody.summary: Questionnaire Assignment - Once per week with a start and end date

FetchAlerts_ResponseBody.summary: Response when fetching alerts for a questionnaire

subtitle.text: Here's to a symptom free day!

footer.text: Responses are not reviewed immediatly. If this is an emergency call 911

header.text: Thank you! Reporting helps us monitor and manage your symptoms.

subtitle.text: We have received your symptom report

footer.text: If you have new or worsening symptoms, or an emergency, please report them through this app, call your care team or 911.

subtitle.text: You can safely manage these symptoms at home. We have saved your responses to Dr. Rosalind Franklin’s records.

footer.text: Responses are not reviewed immediately. If you are experiencing an emergency, please call 911.

additionalInfo.text: Patient has been told to call triage line

subtitle.text: We’ve sent your survey results to Dr. Rosalind Franklin’s team!

writeIn.text: Add an extra note about your symptoms for Dr. Rosalind Franklin’s team (optional)

footer.text: Responses are not reviewed immediately. If you are experiencing an emergency, please call 911.

subtitle.text: Your care team will be notified due to your responses for:

writeIn.text: Add an extra note about your symptoms for Dr. Rosalind Franklin’s team (optional)

footer.text: Responses are not reviewed immediately. If you are experiencing an emergency, please call 911.

subtitle.text: Call 911 or got to an emergency room

footer.text: Responses are not reviewed immediately. If you are experiencing an emergency, please call 911.

subtitle.text: Your care team will be notified due to your responses for:

failureAlert.text: Please contact your care team to report your symptoms.

footer.text: Responses are not reviewed immediately. If you are experiencing an emergency, please call 911.

items.text: What is the severity of your nausea?
